title: Azelis to acquire chemical distribution group KODA
text:
Azelis to acquire chemical distribution group KODA 20 October 2015 
Belgium-based specialty chemical distributor Azelis has signed a binding agreement to acquire the US-based KODA distribution group for an undisclosed sum. 
With this acquisition, Azelis aims to expand its activities in the specialty chemicals and technical service sector, and add value to its partners. 
The transaction is yet to receive regulatory clearance, which is expected to be finalised by the end of this year. "As we got to know the team at KDG, it became clear that they share our values and we believe that they are an excellent partner to expand our business into the USA." 
After completion of the acquisition, KDG will be known as Azelis Americas. 
The new company will be led by KDG CEO and president Frank Bergonzi, who will become a member of the Azelis board of directors. 
Azelis Americas expects to continue to operate in the US and Canada with the help of its existing business model and market strategy. 
It will also maintain its own regional brands and specialty chemicals sales to customers through industry verticals and experts. 
KDG CEO and president Frank Bergonzi said: "Being part of the Azelis Group will provide a strong platform for increased growth and the widespread benefits of being part of a global organisation with a regional focus. 
"This agreement will allow us to be closer to our principals and engage with them on a global level, helping to facilitate new opportunities for our future development. 
"The Azelis approach to the specialty chemicals market aligns extremely well with the KDG model. This partnership allows our management, staff and approach to customers and suppliers to remain unchanged." 
Azelis CEO Hans Joachim MÃ¼ller said: "The specialty chemicals market in North America is extremely important, and the trend of suppliers moving their smaller accounts to specialty chemical distributors will continue for some time. 
"As we got to know the team at KDG, it became clear that they share our values and we believe that they are an excellent partner to expand our business into the US and build on our existing business in Canada. 
"Our product portfolios are extremely complementary and demonstrate many synergies with principals, which is a paramount consideration in any acquisition." Follow Us:
